summary: Email correspondence regarding the FBI's delivery of two new drives from the U.S. Attorney's office to the Metropolitan Detention Center for Ghislaine Maxwell. The email chain involves an Assistant U.S. Attorney, a Special Agent, and other individuals coordinating the logistics of the delivery on January 11, 2021.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The recipient of two new drives being delivered by the FBI to the Metropolitan Detention Center where she is held.

persons.name: Assistant United States Attorney
persons.context: Author of the initial email coordinating the FBI's delivery of drives to Ghislaine Maxwell at MDC.

persons.name: Special Agent
persons.context: Coordinating the delivery of the drives from the U.S. Attorney's office to MDC for Ghislaine Maxwell.

connections.description: Working together to coordinate the delivery of drives to Ghislaine Maxwell, with the AUSA authorizing and the Special Agent executing the delivery.
The AUSA is involved in the legal proceedings against Maxwell, facilitating the delivery of materials to her while in detention.
The FBI Special Agent is responsible for delivering items to Maxwell while she is in custody at MDC.

events.title: FBI Drive Delivery to Ghislaine Maxwell
events.description: The FBI delivers two new drives from the U.S. Attorney's office to Ghislaine Maxwell at the Metropolitan Detention Center.

locations: 1 St. Andrew's Plaza, New York, NY 10007
keyFacts: The FBI was involved in delivering two new drives to Ghislaine Maxwell while she was held at the Metropolitan Detention Center on January 11, 2021.
The delivery was coordinated by an Assistant United States Attorney from the Southern District of New York and an FBI Special Agent.
The correspondence shows ongoing legal and logistical activities related to Maxwell's case while she was in custody.
